_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: QA holding and old freezer evaporators
_prev_prog_3.Description:
Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company, Clarksville, is in compliance with OSHA Standard 29CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

Administrative and Engineering Controls in place to mitigate or reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia.

* Electronic ammonia detection located in each machine room bay for a total of three (3) sensors.
*  Detection system activates a central audible alarm system throughout the facility to alert personnel that a potential emergency exists.
*  Machine room detection activates exhaust fans to vent room as soon as possible. Exhaust fans blow out of room away from personnel to eliminate potential exposure during venting.  Louvers also open on south wall of machine room to provide cross flow during the ventilation sequence.
*  High and low level switches are installed on all pressure vessels (excluding oil pots) to alert refrigeration personnel of any deviations from normal operating conditions within that particular vessel, or the refrigeration system as a whole. 
*  Safety relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels, condensers and oil separators to eliminate possible over pressurization conditions within those associated pieces of equipment and throughout the system.
*  Refrigeration operators make rounds every four (4) hours and log equipment status to track system performance.  
*  Production operates 6:00 am - 12:00 pm, with fire watch/security trained personnel on duty to cover the off shift hours as well as  holidays.  During off shift hours a refrigeration tech is on call for securtiy to notify in case of an emergency.
*  Periodic maintenance program is in place to ensure the entire refrigeration system is maintained in optimum operational and mechanical condition at all times.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company
             Clarksville, Arkansas Food Processing Facility
                                    
                       EPA Risk Management Program
                            Executive Summary
                                    
                                    
1.   Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Polices

This Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company manufacturing site complies with applicable federal,
state and local regulations.  This food processing facility has a formal worker safety program.  All
employees are informed of hazards in the workplace.  Employees who work with potentially
hazardous substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances.  This facility has
procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous
substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response
procedures.

2.   Facility and Regulated Substances

This food processing facility is located at I-40 Exit 58, Clarksville, Arkansas.  Frozen prepared
foods are produced at this location.  Raw vegetables are received, washed, peeled, cooked,
mixed, formed, frozen and packaged.  The regulated substance at this facility, anhydrous
ammonia, is used in a closed-loop refrigeration system for product cooling and freezing.

3.   Worst-Case and Alternate-Case Release Scenarios

The worst-case scenario consists of the release of ammonia from the largest vessel over a period
of ten minutes.  The maximum quantity of ammonia in the vessel is limited to 80-percent of the
total volume of 11,050 pounds via written administrative controls, resulting in a release of
approximately 8,800 pounds of ammonia.  There are off-site impacts under this worst-case
scenario.

The alternate-case scenario consists of the release of ammonia vapor from a safety relief valve due
to an overpressure condition in a vessel located in the facility s machine room

.  The relief valve is
designed to vent ammonia to the atmosphere when its pressure rating is exceeded, preventing
potential damage to other components in the refrigeration system.  The scenario results in a 172-
pound ammonia release over a period of 11 minutes.  There are off-site impacts under the
alternate-case scenario.

4.   General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention

This Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company manufacturing locations comply with the OSHA
Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to
anhydrous ammonia.  Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation and
maintenance of the ammonia   refrigeration system.  Further, refrigeration system operators have
been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the refrigeration system.
The ammonia refrigeration system at this facility has been designed and constructed using good
engineering practices and to conform to industry standards.  The system includes ammonia
detection devices, an emergency shutdown switch located outside the main mechanical room,
high- and low-level switches in pressure vessels, and safety relief valves to avert serious system
overpressure.  Periodic maintenance on the refrigeration system is ensured via the use of a
computerized maintenance management system.  Annual physical system audits are performed by
an external refrigeration contractor to ensure system integrity. 

5.   Five Year Accident History

During the past five years this facility has had one release that resulted in an offsite evacuation. 
The evacuation was performed as a precautionary measure.

6.   Emergency Response Program

At this facility the primary emphasis is to safely evacuate all employees in the event of an
accidental release, pursuant to the requirements of OSHA 1910.38 (a).  Coordination with the
local fire department and LEPC is initiated during an emergency situation.
